description.narrative: The CARE Integrated Community Development in Remote and Disadvantaged Districts Program (ICDP) proposes to contribute to the wellbeing of four communities living in the most disadvantaged areas of PNG. The anticipated outcomes of ICDP are: 1) strengthened and better informed communities working in partnership with government and non-government organisations to identify, prioritise and address development needs; 2) improved access to basic services, with greater government and civil society capacity to deliver and advocate for these services; and 3) improved and more secure and self reliant livelihoods. The Program will support subsistence and income earning livelihoods, basic education, informal adult education, primary health care, HIV/AIDS prevention, and law and justice. It will also strengthen community, non-government and government organisations. The project locations include districts of Eastern Highlands, Morobe, Gulf and Sandaun provinces.
